subtitle: Commanding Windows targets with speed and stealth

learning_objectives: Select the right Windows shell for each engagement scenario

Document Windows commands in reusable transcript formats
Anchor FASTER cues to maintain composure on Windows hosts

content_blocks.title: FASTER Focus

content.text: FASTER your windows shell control practice. Forget any panic tied to blue-team tooling, activate by checking in with your breathing, visualise a mission control console, teach forward with a reminder in your transcript log, enter by launching the customised PowerShell profile, and review when your daily transcript replay reminder fires.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Reset your mindset so each command is deliberate, not rushed.
memory_aids: Forget → Active → State → Teach → Enter → Review
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Operators who control their state make fewer mistakes when pivoting on Windows domains.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: What default ritual helps you enter a calm, focused state before remoting into a host?

content_blocks.title: Key Moves

content.text:
## Execution Checklist
- **Use PowerShell profiles to preload offensive aliases**
- **Reference execution policy bypass snippets from your toolkit**
- **Mirror every Windows action in your engagement notes**

Review this checklist before touching a target machine.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Keep these three priorities in sight when you work on Windows hosts.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Client-facing teams standardise these steps to keep transcripts admissible in reports.

content_blocks.title: Scenario Lab

content.text:
### Lab Goal: Operate on Windows hosts using stealthy native tooling
1. Create a PowerShell profile that loads helper functions for recon and file transfer.
2. Execute a signed-script bypass and log the output with Start-Transcript.
3. Use certutil and bitsadmin to retrieve and execute a payload in a lab VM.
4. Debrief the experience via a teach-back voice memo tied to FASTER.

Capture artefacts as you go so the reporting section writes itself.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Run the sequence, grab proof, and narrate your learning.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Red-teamers rehearse these precise steps before live client operations.

content.text:

- What signal told you the approach was working?
- How will you elevate your state faster the next time you pivot to Windows?
- Who will you debrief using the mission control checklist analogy?
